content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are given a markdown-formatted text `md`. Write a function `q_and_a_extractor` to extract all text in the markdown sections Question and Answer (starting with `# Question` and `# Answer`, respectively) and return the answer in a tuple like `(question,answer)`. Strip any leading spaces and newlines from the extracted text.

```julia
using Markdown
using StringSpans

function q_and_a_extractor(md::AbstractString)
    md_doc = parse(md)

    results = []
    for sec in eachsection(md_doc)
        # Skip if not a Question or Answer section
        if sec.header1 != "# Question" || sec.header2 != "# Answer"
            continue
        end

        # Get question and answer text without leading spaces and newlines
        question = clean_text(sec.inner1)
        answer = clean_text(sec.inner2)

        pushresult!([results; (question, answer)])
    end

    return results
end

# Function to clean text
function clean_text(text::String)
    # Trim leading spaces and newlines
    text = rtrim(text)
    # Replace all leading spaces and newlines with a single space
    text = regexpr(text, r"([\s\n])+") ?= r" "
end
```
